{{Infobox military structure |name= La Noblette Aerodrome |partof= [[American Expeditionary Forces]] (AEF) |location= Located near: [[Mourmelon-le-Grand]], France |coordinates={{Coord|49|06|57|N|004|23|27|E}} |image= [[File:103d Aero Squadron - HQ Staff.jpg|300px]] |caption= Operations staff, 103d Aero Squadron at La Noblette Aerodrome, early 1918 |pushpin_map= France |pushpin_label= La Noblette Aerodrome |latNS=N|latd=49|latm=06|lats=57 |longEW=E|longd=004|longm=23|longs=27 |pushpin_mapsize=300 |type= Combat Airfield |code= |built=1918 |builder= |materials= |height= |used=1918–1919 |demolished= |condition= Agricultural area |ownership= |controlledby= [[File:US Army Air Roundel.svg|15px]]  [[Air Service, United States Army]] |garrison= [[3d Pursuit Group]]
United States [[First Army Air Service]] |commanders= |occupants= |battles= [[File:World War I War Service Streamer without inscription.png|150px]]
[[World War I]] |events= }} '''La Noblette Aerodrome''', was a temporary [[World War I]] airfield in France. It was located {{convert|1.6|mi|km}} Southeast of the [[Communes of France|commune]] of [[Mourmelon-le-Grand]], in the [[Marne]] [[Departments of France|department]] in north-eastern France. ==Overview== The airfield's origins are undetermined. It was used by the [[103d Aero Squadron]] shortly after its pilots were incorporated into the [[Air Service, United States Army]] from the French [[Lafayette Escadrille]] and [[Lafayette Flying Corps]] in February, 1918. It was used as the squadron's main operating base. From La Noblette, the Americans flew daily patrols against enemy aircraft over the Champagne Sector. In early April, the squadron moved to the Aisne sector and began flying from the [[Bonne Maison Aerodrome]]. Its subsequent history is undetermined. After the armistice, the airfield was returned to agricultural use. Today it is a series of cultivated fields located southeast of Mourmelon-le-Grand, with no indications of its wartime use. ==See also== {{Portal|Military of the United States|World War I}} * [[List of Air Service American Expeditionary Force aerodromes in France]] ==References== {{Air Force Historical Research Agency}} {{Reflist}} {{refbegin}} * Series "D", Volume 2, Squadron histories,. Gorrell's History of the American Expeditionary Forces Air Service, 1917–1919, National Archives, Washington, D.C. {{refend}} ==External links== {{Wwi-air}} [[Category:20th-century military history of the United States]] [[Category:Aviation in World War I]] [[Category:World War I airfields]]
